meanings.definition: To cause to be excessively excited or agitated.
meanings.sent1: Watching fireworks overexcites my little sister.
meanings.sent2: The loud music overexcites the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The puppy overexcites easily when you play with a squeaky toy.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news overexcites her like a shaken soda can.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride overexcites me with its twists and turns.

meanings.definition: To become excessively excited or agitated.
meanings.sent1: Children overexcite easily during birthday parties.
meanings.sent2: The puppy overexcites whenever someone new visits the house.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a snow day overexcites the students in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her heart overexcites with joy when she sees her favorite band live.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of Christmas morning overexcites the young boy.
